title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.9 | 14-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
Chaksharan Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam
Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 9th verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Mandasya Mandasya
Prajnasya
Vayo Mandayushas Chavai
Nidrayahriyate Enaktam Divacha Vyartakarmabhihi
The meaning of this verse is
Lazy human beings with paltry intelligence and a short duration of life
pass the night sleeping and the day performing activities that are for naught.
So here

Shounaka Rishi

So therefore, Prabhupada says, one should definitely try to understand
that sense enjoyment is not the ultimate goal of human life.
It is available anyway in all forms of creature.
Herein it is said that during the daytime one works for nothing.
When it is said one works for nothing means there is only one goal ultimately of all materialistic persons.
They work simply for sense enjoyment, that's all.
But that sense enjoyment is not at all giving us happiness or real pleasure.
That's all.
It doesn't give us happiness or pleasure.
Because it is a sensation by sense contact which is momentary,
which is just for the short moment that there is contact.
Just like you place one piece of sweet on your tongue,
that contact, supposing you like that sweet,
that sweet taste.
Moment the contact there is some sensation of sweet taste,
ah, so nice.
But can you keep on telling, oh very nice, sweet taste, very nice, sweet taste, very nice, sweet taste, very nice, sweet taste, very nice.
Can you keep on telling like that?
No.
That sweet taste, the sensation will last only for a moment.
And then after that you have to place one more piece of sweet for one more sensation by contact.
samsparishvaja bhoga.
This is described in Bhagavad Gita.
This material pleasure is nothing but the sense contact producing a sensation for a moment
which we think is oh so nice, so enjoyable, so pleasure.
But this is waste of time.
There is spiritual happiness which is not momentary,
which is not by sense contact,
which is the natural pleasure of the soul,
which is always the normal condition of spiritual existence.
Without any endeavor to get some pleasure.
So that is what awaits us in the human form of life if we take to Krishna consciousness.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
